summary.para: The get_AvgFrameRate method retrieves the actual average frame rate since streaming started.

param.name: piAvgFrameRate
param.para: Pointer to a variable that receives the actual number of frames per second, multiplied by 100. For example, an average frame rate of 30 frames per second will be represented as 3000.

remarks.para: The actual frame rate during playback might be less than the authored frame rate. For more information on actual versus authored frame rates, see the Remarks section for the VIDEOINFOHEADER structure.

summary.para: The get_AvgSyncOffset method retrieves the average time difference between when the video frames should have been displayed and when they actually were.

param.name: piAvg
param.para: Pointer to the time difference, expressed in milliseconds.

summary.para: The get_DevSyncOffset method retrieves the average time difference between when the video frames should have been displayed and when they actually were. This method is the same as the method except that the value returned is calculated as a standard deviation rather than as a simple average.

param.name: piDev
param.para: Pointer to a value denoting the accuracy of the video frames displayed.

remarks.para: When playing video from networks, the presentation can often be disrupted by network glitches. For this reason, expressing the accuracy of video frames by a simple average is inappropriate. Looking at a standard deviation provides a better idea of the overall accuracy.

summary.para: The get_FramesDrawn method retrieves the number of frames actually drawn since streaming started.

param.name: pcFramesDrawn
param.para: Pointer to the number of frames drawn since streaming started.

summary.para: The get_FramesDroppedInRenderer method retrieves the number of frames dropped by the renderer.

param.name: pcFrames
param.para: Pointer to the number of frames dropped by the renderer.

remarks.para: The property page uses this method to retrieve data from the renderer.

summary.para: The get_Jitter method gets the jitter (variation in time) between successive frames delivered to the video renderer.

param.name: iJitter
param.para: Receives the standard deviation of the interframe time, in milliseconds.

summary.para: The IQualProp interface provides methods for retrieving performance information from video renderers. The values returned through the interface are reset each time the filter is stopped. The Video Renderer filter and the Full Screen Renderer filter expose this interface.
Applications can use this interface to retrieve video performance information.
